alert.note: Alert for Davidson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 1:36PM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Cumberland River Near Bordeaux affecting Davidson County. For the Cumberland River...including Bordeaux...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Cumberland River Near Bordeaux. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, Low lying areas along the river from the I-65 bridge to areas near Tennessee State University begin to be inundated, including portions of the Cumberland River Greenway, and Bordeaux Gardens Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM CST Thursday the stage was 30.2 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 30.0 feet. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 745 AM CST.
